reviewText: Incredible story of how music is so effective in treating a litany of both physical and mental problems. The music of New Orleans is featured in this film, which adds to its charisma. Always a pleasure to watch Joaquim de Almeida and Aunjanue Ellis deserves and Oscar for her portrayal of a woman suffering from Alzheimer's. Everyone should see this great movie!

Who would have expected a musical with Alzheimer's as a theme?  But it works and the result is a great film.  A doctor harbors guilt because he was unable  to save his mother who died of dementia-related  issues.  By chance, he meets a New Orleans street singer who suffers from Alzheimer's.  The doctor takes her  under his wing  using music as  therapy.  Fine performances, good music, and a touching story -- this is one of the most underrated films of the recent past.
Beautifully conceived and presented'
To slow
Another feel good story - I enjoyed it.
i didn't like low budget movie: Don't wast time watching
Very good movie.  Kind of sad, but heartwarming.
Great movie
A story well told.
ok
This was a very different look at Alzheimer's Disease.  The story definitely reflected what I saw my mother go through in battling this horrible disease.  Very well acted by all of the actors.
Aunjanue Ellis did such a wonderful job portraying a woman with Alzheimer's Disease.  It was thought provoking and beautiful.
Very moving. Highly recommend this emotional movie.
Well acted. Very depressing.

Nice movie I was able to get into the drama since I went through the same experience with my father, unfortunately there are so many people with that horrible Alzheimer's disease, hope they find a cure soon.
Great

I like the way the central problem (dementia) was  brought to the forefront. The music was beautiful, and yet something was drastically out of order. The intertwining of several stories: the doctor's mother, the singer who sang beautifully, the musician, and the young woman with a drug addiction played out masterfully on the screen. I wept because I too am affected. My mom has dementia.
Lovely, timely story with real emotion and talent but needed sharper editing.  a little too languid.
Simply hopeful.
Wonderful movie helps you better understand the struggles and effects of dementia and Alzheimer's.
Great movie that touches your heart. Love the ending!
A little slow moving. Spoken words a little hard to understand.  Good acting.
Slow. Some good parts came out of the movie but there could have been others.
Dragged on too much. Although bits and pieces of the main characters lives were hinted at not enough detail was provided to make the story interesting. The Notebook this is NOT.
This was a very nice portrayal of what happens during the onset of Alzheimers.
Excellent and gut-wrenching! The acting is phenomenal! The music captivating! A must-see!!
Beyond my expectations
Heart wrenching story, beautifully told.
Very poignant and touching movie about a difficult disorder which touches many people.  Well done.
Good look at music  & Alzheimer's.
Did not enjoyed the pace of the movie, we all thought as a group the movie would be more cheerful. We did not watch in its completion. 3 Stars.
Touching movie. While sad, it was rewarding to see how ones loss motivated goodness towards another.
It was an OK movie-no award winner in my opinion
It was a good film. It was moving and it had layers of what happens with Alzheimer's patients.
Very inspiring.
Amazing story.

Music is essential in the care plans of Alzheimer's residents. I have heard residents who cannot speak a word, sing an entire song. The movie was a bit slow at times, but tells an essential truths that caretakers and family members need to know. The key is to expose them to their own favorite music from the past. It's very individual...
Great Movie!
Very thought provoking.
My family and I really enjoyed this movie.  It made me boo hoo cry at the end.  Nice tear jerker.  It is kinda slow, but it's good.  I recommend watching this one.
Must see for anyone who is aging or has an aging person in their Life.
Excellent movie.  Very touching story.
Nice
slow moving but enjoyable
This movie reminded me about what I went through with my God-mother. My heart goes out to anyone who is going through this.
This is an excellent movie and we'll acted.
I thought it was a good movie about a woman who had Alzheimer's and a doctor who tried to help her because he felt that he had not done enough to help his mother who also had Alzheimer's.
Great perspectives on a loved one with mental illness.
Aunjanue Ellis is exquisite, rendering a convincing portrait of a brilliant artist struggling against time to hold her life together.
Of Mind and Music has a very slow pace, but is a very enjoyable film with excellent acting performances. Joaquin de Almeida is super likable and Aunjanue Ellis is soulful and magnetic.
Full of passion, compassion,very informative.
Brilliant work beautiful story like the ending. I enjoyed it.

This was an interesting movie about an accomplished singer who had Alzheimer and how a scientist who was studying the illness  sought to intercede as well as help her find her son who had been taken away from her. As he was been taken away from her, she gave him a harmonica which he kept. When it made a determination to visit her he carried it with him. As he played the harmonica in her presence, he momentarily jogged her memory.
New Orleans backdrop and the story telling, triumph of family connectedness never wanes.
My wife and I really enjoyed the beauty and tenderness of this movie
Not a fast paced movie  Touching and kind
This movie opens the mind of the viewers in reference to various mind conditions. The key is to stay persistent as a care taker. Continue to love.
Lovely characters. Great shots of New Orleans. Schmaltzy.
Fascinating, different, deeply touching.

I usually think it's incredibly unfair to rate a movie you "walk out" on, but guilty as charged:  I tuned out after about 45 minutes.  Having seen my father through Alzheimer's, I could tell that this was yet another movie about the attractive decline of attractive people (and they are -- she's absolutely beautiful, and he's got that Javier Bardem, Jean-Paul Belmondo, life-beaten faces), rather than the harrowing disintegration of a person from someone you know and love to someone reduced to barely basic sentience.  If you're going to go there (and no one's holding a gun to your head to broach the topic) I prefer learning a valuable life lesson rather than indulging a screenwriter's fantasy about a feel-good twilight-of-life story.  Some life experiences, unfortunately, are simply unbearable, yet we bear them.  If you want to know what film can tell you about this stage of life, check out "Amour."  If you want to tell pretty stories of pretty people that don't help me understand the human condition, sell your tickets to someone else, thanks.

A beautiful description of the horrors of someone whose mind is ravaged by Alzheimer's but without the reality of what a care giver has to endure to care for someone with this problem. Worth watching.
Our church group really enjoyed this movie!
Good movie a little slow start but interesting.

This video makes you think. As the story unfolds, we see how a family and friends respond when one of its members starts losing her memory from Alzheimer's. The story is told sensitively and filled with New Orleans' jazz and beautiful scenery.
Interesting, sweet and thought-provoking.
Good music. Moving story.
Wife liked it more than I did. Plodding plot.
Hard to get into. Sad movie
A bit slow, but interesting.
Best movie ever!
I enjoyed the story and love of music .

Very slow moving.  Thought it was going to involve some medical discovery or research by the doctor that helped the person, but that was not the case.  The ending was also anti-climactic and unsatisfying.
Good
I was moved by this smooth story with a very plausible plot. The actors were all excellent choices as they were very believable.
A great drama: Great story, music  & acting.
Wonderful story
Well done, but not for every viewer.  Addresses the disease of Alzheimer in an interesting way.
I really enjoyed this movie. I think anyone who is dealing with a family member who is suffering from alzheimers or dementia should watch this. Shows how music is universal and helps to heal!
I love this movie, it is real and the setting is very beautiful
Beautiful film to watch, listen and love..made me fall in love with New Orleans all over again.married some of the things I love most..music, New Orleans and Spanish magical realism.
Tear jerker.........very touching......worth watching
A lovely film for lovers of music and compassionate human beings.
A bit like watching paint dry.
Wonderful movie and incidentally, great shots of New Orleans.

JUST TOTALLY, TOTALLY STUNNING.  American Literature on film.  Will make the best Christmas gift.  And all the performances were superb and of course Aunjanue Ellis did her thang as usually...just wash your soul with realness of jazz.  Yes.  Her performance are like Morrison's words.  Deep flavor, dee texture that makes the soul dance.  THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU ALL.--margare opine
This movie touched my heart.
Remarkable movie, great character building
Excellent performance of the stars, an important subject and the New Orleans ambiance.
Beautiful from beginning to end.
I could 100% identify with this movie as this horrible disease has stricken both sides of my family.  Even with this, the movie was artfully characterized and performed.  Must see for all.

This movie was worth every second watching it.  I have grandparents with Alzheimer's so it hit home with me.  Even if you are not affected personally by this heart breaking disease it is still an excellent movie.
I would have given this 5 stars but it was much too slow moving.  This beautiful story could have been told in much less time.  Wonderful acting and very touching!
Very inspiring story; beautifully written and directed. Each actor played their role as if it was poetry!!!1
Poignant, but very slow. Predictable end. Enjoyed background and music was beautiful.
I'm hard of hearing and this movie had subtitle.  This movie got to me.  It was also inspiring.
Very nice movie that is family friendly about being a good Samaritan. It happens to be filmed in New Orleans where the majority of people are super friendly.
Movie is emotionally charged -- Family relations are very important when making decisions.
Way better than I expected.
It was ok
Music was awesome
Very tender story.
Great actors!  Did a good job showing the terrible decline in persons with this awful disease.
I really enjoyed this movie. Gives you a lot to think about when it comes to the mind.
A warm, challenging human story with no "offensive" language or conduct.  We enjoyed it supremely!
Wonderful story.....great acting by Sharon Lawrence, a neighbor in Idyllwild.  She is a very giving person in our community.  Amazing that there is a relationship between music and memory.
We really enjoyed it , would watch it again !
This movie has great actors and a wonderful storyline dealing with a relevant topic for today.
An amazing story line that showed the struggles of Alzhiemers in a real and haunting sense. The cinema photography of New Orleans was excellent.
Beautiful movie! Highly recommend. Not only is it a moving story about a woman with Alzheimer's, the sights and music of New Orleans are wonderful.
A very uplifting drama of love, caring, and going beyond your comfort zone to help others in need.
What a wonderful movie! Very rarely a movie comes along that is heartwArming and a TRUE tear jerker. This is now my new favorite movie. Please watch it!
Loved it!
Very realistic look at the devastating disease which is increasing rapidly with the Baby Boomer generation. Holds your interest with great acting and educational too.

I couldn't watch this film, which looked so promising, because there were no subtitles. I don't understand why, when every film from the 1920's on up are subtitled, this one isn't. It's very disheartening to those of us with poor hearing.
Great acting, storyline,, music and location.

Touching and sweet film.  It's tough to not feel down about this growing trend of Alz.  We think it will never happen to us, but, yikes; we know there's a possibility and that is dreadful to ponder.  This film is a little slow, but worth the time spent.

Absolutely wonderful movie, I was looking for a movie with no sex, or profanity and happened upon this one, really heart warming and also informing on the effects of Alzheimer's on not just the person but those around. Came away from this movie with awesome sense of better understanding and how certain things done can help the person and families to cope. and have hope. Recommend this to anyone.

A nice movie good acting. Heartbreaking. And in reality a street women with Alzheimer's at this level would most likely end up in a nursing facility rather than assisted living, which is very expensive. And unless her family is rich it would probably be a state run nursing facility which are for the most part not such good places to end up in. Heartbreaking indeed.
A great film with a rare but close view of Alzheimer's disease. It's educational as well as delightful. Highly recommended
great movie
The story tore at my heart. A disease captured in song, bringing back what is lost. The singing is raw, authentic. I wish there was a soundtrack.

Of Mind And Music is a MUST SEE and MUST SHARE film.  The cast delivers stellar performances and Adams captures the nuance and authenticity of the heartbreaking progression of Alzheimer's Disease, the struggle & pain of the afflicted, their loved ones, and the scientists and physicians racing against time to find a cure.  The beautiful cinematography and soulful score bring New Orleans and her Music alive so that they become characters themselves.  Keep tissues nearby - tears will likely flow as this very human and very relevant story unfolds.

Like his character, author (of the book on which the film is based) and co-writer, Dr Nicolas Bazan, is a renowned Neuroscientist with a love of music and an insatiable drive to conquer neurodegenerative diseases like Alzheimer's and dementia.  Dr. Bazan MD/PhD is the founder and director of the Neuroscience Center of Excellence at Louisiana State University Health Sciences Center in New Orleans.  Not surprisingly, he is donating 70% of his profit from sales of the film to fund research specifically focused on AD.  One would like to think that with the alarming prevalence of AD, there would be ample funding for such important research, but that is not the case.

Of Mind And Music stands on its own as an outstanding indie.  The fact that a portion of profits from film sales will go directly to research - to the front lines of science - is just the icing on the cake!  It's a win, win.  Another reason we must share this film and this story!

OMG.... This is a good movie!  It's slow, but it all comes together in the end.  On some scenes, I cried like a baby.  The performances by the actors were great.  I thoroughly enjoyed this movie.  Worth the watch.

This movie is a love letter to the City of New Orleans and her culture wrapped in a medical mystery. Actors in this movie are all wonderful and give very caring performances. I would recommend this movie if you love the city, it's music and culture, just our vibe. The story is about a woman who has Alzheimer's disease and can't remember most things but she remembers her music and comes alive when she is performing it on the street. Of Mind and Music will take your emotions on a thrill ride as you go with the main character down memory lane to discover her long-lost son. See the movie, you won't regret it.
I really loved this movie. I don't know much about Alzheimer's Disease, but Ellis' peformance was amazing. Very much recommend this movie.

I am lucky to have seen a screening of the film a month or so ago.  My grandmother and now my aunt have been afflicted with Alzheimers and this movie truly touches the heart.  It is more than worth the purchase and the time
Moving, insightful, lovely acting

An absolute must see for anyone that can appreciate music, the enigma of the brain, or the city of New Orleans. This story entails the crippling curiosity of a research scientist that is haunted by the mystery of Alzheimer's disease. He is troubled by personal experiences happening in front of his eyes, as well as one from his past. A once brilliant jazz performer is now hanging on to her sanity by a thread made of music. The doctor accepts the task of trying to understand this detrimental disease. An incredible book, and film, that truly reflects the severity of this disease.

Finally , a modern day movie of importance. Scenes that tug at your heart while exposing Alzheimer's stages.
Entertaining and educational. Great way to gain awareness .
Well written, well acted and well directed.

A masterpiece, deftly combining a compelling story with a powerful message.  As the son of a victim of Alzheimers' disease, I am thrilled to see a film that is engrossing, entertaining, and extremely well directed and acted telling the reality of this global madaly.  The cast is superb, and the gentle pace and ambiance of the story, which features beautiful music intertwined with scenes of the real New Orleans, is interwoven in a delicious recipe of storytelling.  I cannot recommend this film enough.  Buy one for yourself, and buy one for everyone you care about, because it is a rare gift--one that is immensely entertaining while gently showing the tremendous effects of Alzheimers' on us all.

This was very enjoyable. Amazing directing that allows us to see what it would be like to be so afflicted. I don't remember in any other movie I've ever seen where you could put yourself so squarely inside the mind of someone who is just a shell of who they once were, yet at the same time retaining the soul of their craft which wasn't lacking even til the end. Makes you wonder about interacting with someone with dementia. They will seem like no one is "home" but there must be an unexpressed spark still burning inside them that I wish they could somehow articulate.

I'm not getting mushy over some Alzheimer's theme, the movie basically sucked.  The entire movie seemed meaningless except to display an Alzheimer's victim - screw  that.  Mr. Alzheimer should have written a song to go with the disease at least.  Acting was blaze', dialogue insignificant, four characters to the entire movie; and talk about a slow paced movie.
And about Alzheimer's, it will never be cured while a health care system makes big bucks keeping everyone sick.  Remember:  "You are what you eat" is not just a saying, it's the truth.  If you get a disease, stop crying about it or surrendering to it, or feeling like some martyr, but become saintly in what you put into your body, go Alkaline for the most part, no simple carbs, no table salt, no sugar, no grains, no pastas and breads; eat plenty of nuts, veggies, fruits, organic everything, blend raw smoothies daily, study Health as you eat properly and you may actually heal anything.
Beautifully done! Heartfelt and real.  A true reflection of the effect this epidemic has on the lives of those afflicted and their loves ones.
Beautiful and heartfelt! I hope some day soon we find a cure and unlock these troubled minds.
What a wonderful film, well written and beautifully executed
Memorable music.
Great movie addressing an issue we will  all be touched by in our lifetime. Great casting and even better story line.
Good

It started very slow and progressed into a film that speaks to compassion at the deepest level.
Remarkable acting!
Beautiful!
Wonderful movie.  Highly recommend this to others experiencing this horrible illness and remembering those who are dealing with it.
